result.execSummary:
The defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive Or Operate A Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victim T.B. and victims residence.
No contact with firearms.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

supervisions.notes: To be determined at a later date. Hearing December 9, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 36 via ZOOM.

Provide DNA sample.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim witness surcharge, assessments are to be collected by DOC at maximum rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Drive Or Operate A Vehicle Without Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry.  Attorney Michael Staskunas for Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Amended Criminal Complaint received and filed; State withdraws amended criminal complaint. Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement made by T.B., by zoom. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 38 MONTHS, with credit for 173 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 14 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. 

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No contact with victim T.B. and victim's residence.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution to be determined at a later date.
-The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) assessments are to be collected by DOC at MAXIMUM rate from the defendant's prison wages and any other funds and during extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment/tax intercept.  

*Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement. 

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 36; VIA ZOOM. Restitution hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Restitution Form.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk

Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an adjourned plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Dashawndrick D. Perry, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry not in court, in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense received state's offer and requested plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense is waiting on an offer from the State.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion and Notice of Motion for Bail Reduction from Defendant ( Dashawndrick Perry - House of Correction 8885 S 68th St Franklin, WI 53213)
Motion to Dismiss From Defendant ( Dashawndrick Perry - House of Correction 8885 S 68th St Franklin, WI 53213)
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer F. Vences. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke, appear by video.  Defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present due to out with COVID.  Defense moves to dismiss.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed

Defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorny Lamke has a conflict check, need more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Twynna B, and Co-Actor Amarion Washington.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dashawndrick Dantonio Perry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. Defense motion to dismiss/amend COUNT 1 argued and granted by the court. State to file amended complaint by next court date. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
